title: DataHub vs Great Expectations: Which data governance Tool is Better in 2026?
metaDescription: Compare DataHub vs Great Expectations. See pricing, features, pros & cons to choose the best data governance tool for your needs in 2026.
introduction: Choosing between DataHub and Great Expectations for your data governance needs? Both are popular tools in the AI space, but they have different strengths, pricing models, and use cases. This comprehensive comparison breaks down the key differences to help you make an informed decision.

sections.title: Overview: DataHub vs Great Expectations
paragraphs: DataHub is DataHub is an open-source metadata platform originally developed at LinkedIn and now maintained by Acryl Data. It provides a unified system for data discovery, observability, and governance by ingesting, searching, and visualizing technical, operational, and social metadata in real-time. Its key differentiator is its stream-based, real-time metadata architecture (MAE/MCP) that enables immediate reflection of changes across the data ecosystem, making it particularly suited for modern, dynamic data stacks.. It's known for metadata-management, data-catalog, data-lineage.

Great Expectations, on the other hand, is Great Expectations is an open-source Python library that helps data teams build trust in their data through automated validation, documentation, and profiling. It enables users to define, test, and enforce data quality expectations, integrating seamlessly into data pipelines and workflows to catch issues early. Its unique value lies in providing a shared, human-readable language for data quality, fostering collaboration between data engineers, scientists, and analysts.. Users choose it for data-quality, data-testing, data-pipelines.

sections.title: Pricing Comparison
paragraphs: When it comes to value for money, consider your specific use case and team size.

sections.title: Features & Capabilities
paragraphs: DataHub excels in: Stream-based real-time metadata ingestion via Kafka (Metadata Audit Event & Change Proposal), End-to-end column-level data lineage visualization and tracking, Powerful search and discovery with filtering by tags, owners, domains, and glossary terms. This makes it ideal for teams that need metadata-management.

Great Expectations stands out with: Define and manage data quality expectations as versioned, human-readable YAML or JSON files, Automatically generate data profiles and documentation from data sources (e.g., Pandas, Spark, SQL databases), Integrate validation checks into CI/CD pipelines, orchestration tools (Airflow, dbt), and data catalogs. It's particularly strong for users focused on data-quality.

sections.title: Use Cases: When to Choose Each Tool
paragraphs: Choose DataHub if: You need metadata-management, work with data-catalog, or require flexible pricing.
Choose Great Expectations if: You prioritize data-quality, work in data-testing, or prefer their pricing model.

sections.title: Pros & Cons
paragraphs: DataHub Pros: Verified platform, Highly rated (4.5/5), Extensive feature set.
DataHub Cons: Some limitations on free tier.
Great Expectations Pros: Verified platform, Highly rated (4.5/5), Comprehensive features.
Great Expectations Cons: May have feature limitations.

verdict: Both DataHub and Great Expectations are solid choices for data governance. Your choice depends on your specific requirements: DataHub is better for metadata-management, while Great Expectations excels at data-quality. Consider trying both with their free tiers or trials to see which fits your workflow better.
